Class Functions

java.lang.Object
Functions
class Functions
extends java.lang.Object
A set of re-implemented functions for use in COMP108A1Paging.

  • Method Details

    • present

      public static boolean present​(int x, int[] list, int listLength)
      States whether an int is present in an array.

      Requires the length of the list to be searched to avoid counting or using standard libraries.

      Parameters:
      x - The integer to find.
      list - The list to search for the integer.
      listLength - The length of the list that will be searched.
      Returns:
      A boolean stating whether the integer was found in the list.

    • lowestIndex

      public static int lowestIndex​(int[] list, int listLength)
      Returns the index of the smallest element in a list.

      Values are zero indexed.

      Requires the length of the list to be searched to avoid counting or using standard libraries.

      Parameters:
      list - The list to search.
      listLength - The length of the list to be searched.
      Returns:
      The index of the smallest element in the list.

    • highestIndex

      public static int highestIndex​(int[] list, int listLength)
      Returns the index of the largest element in a list.

      Values are zero indexed.

      Requires the length of the list to be searched to avoid counting or using standard libraries.

      Parameters:
      list - The list to search.
      listLength - The length of the list to be searched.
      Returns:
      The index of the largest element in the list.

    • findIndex

      public static int findIndex​(int x, int[] list, int listLength)
      Finds the index of an integer in a list of integers.

      Values are zero indexed.

      This method presumes that the element exists in the list. Ensure you have checked for the presence of the element before calling this method.

      Requires the length of the list to be searched to avoid counting or using standard libraries.

      Parameters:
      x - The integer to be found.
      list - The list to search in.
      listLength - The length of list
      Returns:
      If the element is found the index of the element will be returned. If not then -1 is returned.

    • forwardDistance

      public static int forwardDistance​(int x, int[] list, int listLength, int counter)
      Counts forward in list until x is found. If the element is not found then the length of the list is returned.

      To account for requests in the array that have been served counter can be used to offset the search. Ideally the index of the request currently being served from list should be provided. However, all indexes from counter + 1 will be considered in the search.

      Requires the length of the list to be searched to avoid counting or using standard libraries.

      Parameters:
      x - The element to forward search for.
      list - The list to search for x in.
      listLength - The length of list.
      counter - The index to search forward from. Use -1 to search all elements.
      Returns:
      The index of list where x is found. If the element is not found then listLength is returned to simulate infinity.
